alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Mountains West; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 15 at 5:19PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorm outflow winds will impact portions of north central Hot Springs, Big Horn, northwestern Washakie and east central Park Counties through 600 PM MDT... At 517 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorm outflow winds along a line extending from 12 miles southwest of Medicine Wheel to 9 miles east of Cody. Movement was southeast at 50 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph with gusts between 50 and 60 mph. Gusts over 60 mph have been reported at the Cowley airport. SOURCE...Radar indicated and weather instrument indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Cody, Powell, Worland, Lovell, Greybull, Basin, Meeteetse, Cowley, Byron, Ralston, Otto, Deaver, Garland, Manderson, Shell, Hyattville, Winchester, Hamilton Dome, and Shell Canyon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. If on or near Bighorn Reservoir or on the Bighorn River, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Bighorn Mountains West; Cody Foothills; North Big Horn Basin; Owl Creek and Bridger Mountains; Southeast Big Horn Basin; Southwest Big Horn Basin
